title: What is the difference between MR (music recorded) and live in K-pop music festival performances? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, I’m not an expert on that so correct me please if I’m wrong. MR or Music Recorded is basically the same thing as a karaoke. So, it’s the instrumental. But, generally, MR are not just the instrumental, there is some sounds of the voices of the singers in the background, to make them look better on stage. But, when you are live, it’s that you are actually singing. There is no sounds of your voice in the background. So yes, there is the instrumental, but it’s the actual voice of the singers. So if you listen to a K-pop group in MR, you don’t really know how they sound (it’s why MR Removed exists). But when you listen to a live performance, it’s the real voices of the idols.
